Text.Value: We need some time, if you don't mind.

EditorData.NodeContext: Rolan wants to speak to his siblings alone

Text.Value: You're still here? Thought you'd be halfway to Moonrise and leading the Harpers' charge on the tower. Go on - the day needs saving.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slight smile - this is sincere. He firmly believes the player will save everyone.

Text.Value: Keep drinking like that and you won't be able to read your spellbook, wizard.
Cute - maybe she'll write a ballad about me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

Text.Value: How did you decide which ones to save, and which to leave behind?
I'm fine. It's Cal and Lia who need help.

EditorData.NodeContext: bitterly ashamed he failed to help his siblings

Text.Value: Something is happening in Moonrise - I can feel it from here. Gods.

EditorData.NodeContext: usual arrogance gone - in awe

Text.Value: If you're here to save the day again, you're a little late this time.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sneering, bitter

Text.Value: She can leave out the part where my brother and sister were dragged away screaming while I was saving the orphans.

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter, sad

Text.Value: I wanted to make sure you hadn't wandered off again.
Then it's my responsibility to bring them back.
Oh, it's you. I'd recognise that self-righteous tone anywhere.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

Text.Value: Oh, it's you. Don't you get tired of telling people how to live their lives?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them
EditorData.NodeContext: sneering, bitter

Text.Value: I can't find Cal and Lia. Tell me they're here... tell me you brought them back.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frantic - holding back tears and anger
EditorData.logicalname: Knows Lia  + Cal dead NOT MET

Text.Value: Oh, sod off. I'm only here because you 'helped' me and my family.

EditorData.NodeContext: Heavy sarcasm on 'helped' - not quite doing airquotes but that's the tone

Text.Value: Well, I'm not here to grovel so piss off.

EditorData.NodeContext: hungover, irritated and wants to be left alone

Text.Value: I'm not going anywhere. Not until Cal and Lia return - and they will return.

EditorData.NodeContext: ashamed he couldn't save his siblings, desperately hoping they're all right

Text.Value: Where are your siblings?
Want to talk about your sorrows instead of drowning them?
But you brought some of them back. How did you decide who to save and who to leave behind?

EditorData.NodeContext: lashing out, being hurtful

Text.Value: You should have left me there.

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter, miserable

Text.Value: What magic is powerful enough to pierce the curse like a blade through flesh? Incredible.

EditorData.NodeContext: usual arrogance gone - in awe

Text.Value: They're better off dead than in the cult's hands.
Leave.
I saved as many as I could, but they didn't make it. I'm sorry.
We're done here. But if our paths cross in the city, keep your head down and keep walking, or there'll be trouble.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to calm himself down and talk himself out of being furious - hands up, placating

Text.Value: Yes, yes, you saved me from shadow-creatures. No need to gloat.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hungover and ashamed - the player saved your life, but you can't bring yourself to say thanks until your siblings are safe as well
EditorData.logicalname: Returned from Town - tieflings still in jail

Text.Value: If you lay off the liquor, you might be able to help us fight back.
We won't even have to go out into the shadows to die now that the cultists have found us.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: muttering drunkenly to himself, with his back to the player
EditorData.NodeContext: drunk, gallows humour, talking into his drink rather than directly at the player

Text.Value: Jaheira didn't save your ragged little tail from the cultists - I did.

EditorData.NodeContext: venemous - bitter, addressed to Umi

Text.Value: I am getting tired of having to swoop in and rescue you all.
I was ready to cut and run back at the grove, but you had other ideas.
I am getting tired of having to swoop in and rescue you all.
You bastard! I should turn your blood to fire.

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious in grief - looking for someone to blame

Text.Value: I'm sorry.
The kid's right - you need to lay off the liquor.
Want to talk about your sorrows instead of drowning them?
If you find any more traitors, kill them quietly. I'm trying to enjoy my drink.

EditorData.NodeContext: slurring his words, drunk

Text.Value: Carl and Liam? I don't think I know them.
I'd rather drown than talk to a sanctimonious prick like you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them
EditorData.NodeContext: bitter - emphasis on 'rather' - he's responding to a line about 'talking about his sorrows rather than drowning them' and he's being sarcastic

Text.Value: ...There's another bottle of Arabellan Dry back there. Put it on the bar, then piss off and leave me alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slurring slightly, a little bit drunk and irritable - talking to Ide, a tiefling child behind the bar

Text.Value: I don't need your help, and I don't need your pity.

EditorData.NodeContext: quietly, bitter

Text.Value: ...There's another bottle of Arabellan Dry back there. Put it on the bar, then piss off and leave me alone.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: In case something goes wrong with initial scene with kids and gets interrupted. No hasmet needed as you will always get the quest from here
EditorData.NodeContext: Acting friendly but on edge

Text.Value: Jaheira said we should serve drinks, but that we shouldn't serve drunks.

EditorData.NodeContext: cheerful, playing the part of a bartender - it's a game to him and this is a line he's learned

Text.Value: I'd rather be torn limb from limb than give in to those bastards.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: looks over his shoulder at the player scornfully

Text.Value: Leave.
Myself? No, you god-bothering idiot, I blame you.
Sorry won't bring them back.
What's wrong? Can I help?
Alfira told me you already saved some of these people from the cult.
I'm sorry, Rolan - I couldn't save the prisoners at Moonrise. They're all dead.
Cheer up, Rolan - no need to be glum.
Nobody at Moonrise survived.
Do you know where they are?
You saved the kid? Sounds like you deserve a drink.
Simple - you kept up, or you died.
They were. And you should have been there to hear their screams when they were dragged away.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after noticing them, and sneers at them

Text.Value: You did what you could. I'm the one that should have done more.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Facing away - speaks to player over shoulder
EditorData.NodeContext: Grieving but trying to process it. Grateful to player.

Text.Value: Oh, I will.
That's all I wanted - back at the grove. But you had other ideas.
I tried. Maybe she'll write a ballad about me.
Is that a joke? I wouldn't be here if it wasn't for you.
Stay the hells away from me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standing at bar - speaks to player over shoulder
EditorData.NodeContext: Angry - he's already warned us to leave him alone

EditorData.stateContext: Rolan is facing the bar, not the player -

Text.Value: I'm sure they're cowering in their heavily fortified tower knowing you're on the way.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: looks over his shoulder at the player scornfully
EditorData.NodeContext: sarcastic

Text.Value: Bullshit. If they're alive, I can save them.
Alfira said you risked everything to save her and the kids.

EditorData.stateContext: Rolan has turned to face the player

Text.Value: I heard your siblings were taken by the cult.
I wanted to save everyone, but couldn't.
I've thanked you once already. Don't be greedy.

EditorData.NodeContext: Slight smile - half joking

Text.Value: Look, I just want to get out of this cursed hellhole.
I heard your siblings were already taken by them.
Nobody else is dying here.
Something's on your mind - spit it out.
They died at Moonrise.
Stop whining and do something about it.
Dead for all I know. Or in the cult's tower with the others who were taken.
I am absolutely going to gloat - I saved your life.
Stop blaming yourself, it's pathetic. Accept the will of the gods - however it falls.
You must not blame yourself, Rolan. You have suffered plenty already.
I sense your cup overflows with pain. Do not blame yourself, Rolan.
If they're alive, I'll rescue them.
I came to check on you, that's all.
Nobody else is dying. I'll deal with the cultists.
Then it's done - I should have died with them.

EditorData.NodeContext: grief-stricken

Text.Value: You go save the world, or your own arse, or whatever it is you do. I'll fix this.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns away, back to the bar when he's done talking

Text.Value: And you'll be too drunk to care when they cut your throat. Smart.
Saving you from the shadows was a choice - what happened at Moonrise was an accident.
It might not be too late for the others - let me help.
Scared? Maybe you should have surrendered when you had the chance.
I heard about the attack in the shadowlands. I'm here to help.
Don't worry - I'm not going anywhere.

EditorData.NodeContext: hungover, waving away the player - you want to be left alone

Text.Value: Cal and Lia were taken in by your crap. You convinced them to play hero, and now they're gone.
They're my responsibility.
Cheers.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: turns to the player, smiles sarcastically and raises his glass
EditorData.NodeContext: sarcastic

Text.Value: That's the same mistake I made when they were taken. It's not a mistake I'll make again.
Alfira told me you're the reason her and the kids escaped.
If you hadn't filled their heads with all that self-righteous heroic crap at the grove, none of this would have happened.

Synopsis:
Rolan is an apprentice wizard whose siblings were recently captured by cultists. He's stuck in a tavern in the middle of the cursed lands where they were taken, drinking heavily, blaming himself for their loss. When he sees the players, he turns his frustration onto them - he's only here because they convinced him to stay with the other tieflings who were captured in the first place.

Rolan is in fact the only reason any of the tieflings are still alive, having protected them from the traitorous Zevlor, who planned to give them over to the cult. He doesn't feel like a hero though - he feels like a failure.
